responses.content: We now have inference time scaling joining pretraining and post-training as a third set of exponential growth laws; reasoning agents generate 100x more tokens, and Blackwell NVLink72 (GB200) is specifically built to deliver 25x throughput and 20x lower cost for those workloads.

GB200 NVLink72 shipments are rocketing with hyperscalers deploying thousands of racks weekly, GB300 samples are rolling out, and AI factories across sovereigns and enterprises are accelerating token-generation capacity as we prepare for Blackwell Ultra.

The new H20 licensing requirement effectively cut off the Chinese Hopper business, but we continue to look for compliant options while building onshore manufacturing partners and enabling AI factories worldwide.

Spectrum-X, Quantum-X, NVLink Fusion, NVLink switches, and BlueField are creating the full-stack networking foundation for AI factories with 130 TB/sec NVLink 72 domains and Ethernet that handles bursty, inference-era traffic.

We recognized $4.5B write-down on H20 inventory/purchase obligations as export controls hit, limiting our ability to ship $2.5B of backlog; excluding that charge the quarter would have delivered 71.3% non-GAAP gross margin.
CapEx remains elevated at >$30B, prioritizing short-lived GPUs/CPUs plus finance leases; cash flow supported $14.3B returned through buybacks and dividends while keeping Blackwell ramp on track.
Q2 assumes an ~$8B China revenue drop because Hopper/H20 canâ€™t ship; we are modeling the headwind actively while continuing to build supply chain capacity and focus on serviceable markets.

questions: How much of the surging reasoning inference demand are you able to serve today, and do you need more NVL72 rack-scale deployments?
Is the $15B China impact still baked into future quarters and how should we think about modeling the build-out toward the trillion-dollar AI investment idea?
Are there additional large-scale AI factory orders beyond the published ones and how are these orders affecting your Blackwell lead times?
Does your guidance imply the portion of the business outside China accelerated to offset the H20 loss, and does the renewed AI diffusion policy give you more confidence in sequential momentum?
Is NVIDIA building a licensed H20 replacement for China, and how quickly could you return to pre-control quarterly revenue run rates once a compliant product is ready?
Can you expand on the momentum in networking, specifically Spectrum-X adoption by CSPs and any change in network attachment rates?

metadata.source: NVIDIA FY2026 Q1 earnings call transcript
